TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Finished my on-orbit refuelling station in my Science Sandbox campaign, test-ran a few mods, and restarted a full Career campaign.

Not really much of anything interesting to talk about this past weekend, other that to say that my six year old has decided to give KSP a whirl. I'm sure he'll do fine as soon as he can remember how to steer; at the moment he's a proper Kerbal.

My own self, I was largely doing minor contracts - parts tests, a sat contract or two, and a rescue contract, all while awaiting various crews to make their way out to Minmus. I did decide the time had come for me to get Val and her tourists off the surface of Mun (they've been stranded there for quite some time now), so I designed Hound Dog 7 and shot Bill off that direction with a KIS screwdriver and a couple of KAS connector ports. Going to try piping out the tourists this time around rather than beaming them over a fiber optic winch cable. I'll need to tweak the Hound Dog design if I ever have to use it again; I use PartRecovery to keep costs down, and let's just say there were enough issues with decoupling going on that I didn't recover that many parts. Time to start using Sepratrons...
Gave an engine a makeover.

I set down my first ever mining / refining operation on Minmus!

Big milestone as a pretty new player.

Been engulfed in the RSS RO RVE world lately...

I sent two T-100 tugs in tandem to my new station. All I have so far is the core section.

After docking both T-100's I wanted to fix the inclination and altitude of my station using the tugs. I jettisoned the engine after conducting a short 4 minute burn. Circularized 420 km orbit

I have Bill, Bob and Jeb in the station. They only had 3 weeks of supplies left. So I sent a supply ship up on the next launch window.

After a lazy 4 day rendezvous the supply ship safely docked.

In 4-6 weeks I will load it full of waste and deorbit the supply ship.

Graphics great, which mod is?

Graphics great, which mod is?

FASA, NearFuture (Construction, Electrical, Props, Spacecraft), Chaka Monkey Exploration Odyssey, station parts expansion. As well I make all my fuel tanks with procedural parts.

To look the best I use planetshine, RSS, RO, RVE.
Mostly finished construction of my new LKO space station... Coming along nicely. Could actually be finished, but that leaves a docking port on top with no plans for it...

Built a De Havilland Mosquito replica, not yet finished:

http://i.imgur.com/dsMGMQl.png

Hey, that's supposed to be plywood buddy. Looks great!

I crashed, repeatably, back to desktop. Which is sad, since I wanted to fly my difficult to land but fast plane back to the KSC. By the time it got there it should even have been easier to land thanks to CoM shift.
...and launched a refurbished type of orelifter, here with a new mobile drillrig docked to the ridicilous big fuelrefinery ...

Attempted my first ever Mun resource scanning satellite. Early attempts ended with the craft tumbling out of control on ascent. Scrapped that design. Started from scratch by placing the M700 below the fuel tank and mounting 2 twitch engines to the tank. Using 2 radial decouplers, I mounted 2 FL-T800 tanks with LV-T45 engines. The radial tanks took me to orbit and half the transfer burn. Then I realized I forgot the comm antenna. D'oh. Reverted. Relaunched. Made it to Mun. Circularized. Changed inclination to a polar orbit. Realized the orbit was a little short of 25k around Mun. Raised the Ap to 27k at the Pe. Warped to Ap for circularization burn. As I was dropping out of warp, there was the most magnificent ball of smoke and flames. Why did it blow up? I have no idea. This resource satellite is kicking my butt.

Sadly it was dark & i didn't see were exactly it's going down !!!

Landed on a mountain & mostly destroyed

they have to wait for rescue ship ...
After couple test flights of OK-GLI, now I got to the next part of this project - lauching the ship to space. The balancing is somewhat manageable, but the boosters are still giving me trouble
Forgot to attach a rover into the cargo bay of my SSTO before rolling it out.

FASA, NearFuture (Construction, Electrical, Props, Spacecraft), Chaka Monkey Exploration Odyssey, station parts expansion. As well I make all my fuel tanks with procedural parts.

To look the best I use planetshine, RSS, RO, RVE.

my planets look ugly

which mod creates good looking textures ?
Started working on some vacuum engines for SpaceY Expanded. This is a 3.75m unit, but the larger diameters will have clusters of these.

Sure. This is from an earlier version of KSP. I was doing photo shoots at Kerbin of these. The lander and rover/ boat together. At Laythe, I would separate the rover from the lander just after dropping from orbit. I landed each using chutes so as not to use precious fuel. I had to balance the rover with science parts which could jettison. Now we have better parts to use but here's the old pic. Notice the combination of jets, spikes and nukes:

https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3773/13192238193_68b09d1a1e_o.png

Here is the rover on its own:

https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7353/13192339823_633b13f781_o.png

Here is the assembly on an intermediate (not the launch) stage; I took the engines off for the shot. I asparagus staged the fuel tanks:

https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7182/13196643993_680388fb6d_o.png

Awsome! Thanks for the feedback!
Sent my satellite relay to Duna. Note how they each have connection to each other on their journey.

I would download the RVE mod here. As well download the RSS mod for a earth size planet and download one of the textures. Seriously after you play with this you won't go back to the old KSP world. If you have any more questions feel free to PM.

Hellblazer

SAP-C's R&D detected mysterious debris near the KSC, and deployed a newly developed Gosling Light Tank to investigate, designed to be paradropped from a Goose Cargo Plane. The Gosling was met by a V1 Boar tank that was hiding away in the complex complexes of the KSC, but the Gosling had the upper hand, after the Boar missed the first shot. The Gosling surprisingly destroyed the Boar (I gave the Gosling a big advantage, okay? Such as getting to shoot more than the Boar) after decimating it's probe core with a lucky sho- I mean precisely aimed shot.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The Gosling brung the debris back to the R&D where it was found to be from a rocket bringing an armed drone to somewhere in the Kerbin system, most likely the Mun. To be continued on Mun wars: The Drone wars.

a lucky sho- I mean precisely aimed shot.

Luck is a skill in of itself... Or so New Vegas has led me to believe.

A very kerbal mission. Five (six) crew, docking port, wheels, Mun. Three biomes, six three-star crew came home. Sort of.

Majorly miscalculated the torque required to flip it on-end on the Mun... had to take a run up on a steep hill, which didn't do the tyres a lot of good. Always carry a three star engineer! Or just jettison your busted wheels, that works too...

Also, stability. Don't talk to me about stability. When it accelerated, the engines hit the ground. When it braked, the nose dug in. Mission commander Brigadier Riv had to limit the whole expedition to 10m/s cruising speed to avoid catastrophe :< It did have enough fuel to rendezvous with Skylab I however, and dumped a full 550 data into it (some still awaiting processing), so there's a looooot of science coming down from on-high over the next few months
More,preparations for my sts mission series!
Quick question, is are the Sat. Relays farther in the tech. tree or is that a mod?

Quick question, is are the Sat. Relays farther in the tech. tree or is that a mod?

Most of the parts are stock (and those that aren't are generally just bigger/different antennae) but the actual use of satellite relays is not necessary in the stock game. For that, you want RemoteTech.

The stock game will be getting some need for satellite relays in 1.1.
